meanings.definition: Writings or statements of dubious authenticity or authorship.
meanings.sent1: The professor questioned the apocrypha of the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: The detective was unsure about the apocrypha of the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent3: The apocrypha of the ghost story made it even more mysterious.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were like apocrypha, hard to believe but intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The apocrypha of the legend added an element of uncertainty to its truth.

meanings.definition: A collection of religious texts not included in the canonical Bible.
meanings.sent1: The library displayed an ancient apocrypha of religious texts.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study the apocrypha to understand different religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The apocrypha of bedtime stories included tales of magical creatures.
meanings.sent4: Her bookshelf held an apocrypha of forgotten tales and legends.
meanings.sent5: The apocrypha shed light on lesser-known aspects of religious history.
